definition: one side of the story/one-sided statement
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: So is this just a Wall Street trope?
sentences.chinese: Careny問到，”這僅僅是華爾街的一面之詞？

sentences.english: You're hearing one side of the story.
sentences.chinese: 你聽到的只是一面之詞。

sentences.english: History is always written by the winners.
sentences.chinese: 就其本質而言，歷史始終是一面之詞。

sentences.english: You only hear Monica's side of that.
sentences.chinese: 你只聽到了莫妮卡的一面之詞。

sentences.english: Of course, these are digital distributors talking here.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這僅僅是數字漫畫分銷商的一面之詞。
美國媒體都是一面之詞。

sentences.english: I do not want to hear what reason says.
sentences.chinese: 我不想聽理性的一面之詞。

sentences.english: And I just take your word?
sentences.chinese: 而我相信你的一面之詞？

sentences.english: By its very nature, history is always a one-sided account.
sentences.chinese: 就其本質而言，歷史始終是一面之詞。

sentences.english: He thought he would have the Arkansas press all to himself.
sentences.chinese: 他以爲阿肯色州的媒體都會聽他的一面之詞。

sentences.english: You've only heard his side of the story.
sentences.chinese: 你只聽了他的一面之詞。
